meanings.definition: A series of things placed one after another
meanings.sent1: The serries of books on the shelf looked neat and organized.
meanings.sent2: I enjoyed watching the serries of cars drive by on the road.
meanings.sent3: The serries of ducks waddling in a line made me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings formed a colorful serries that brightened the room.
meanings.sent5: The serries of colorful flags fluttered in the wind, creating a festive atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To arrange in a series or succession
meanings.sent1: She carefully serries the cups on the shelf to keep them organized.
meanings.sent2: The librarian will serries the books on the shelves by genre.
meanings.sent3: He serries his socks by color, making it easier to find a pair.
meanings.sent4: The chef will serries the ingredients before starting to cook.
meanings.sent5: The students will serries their desks in rows for the exam.
